meanings.definition: To set up a blockade around (a place or area)
meanings.sent1: The pirates blockaded the harbor to prevent any ships from entering.
meanings.sent2: During the war, the enemy navy blockaded the coast, cutting off all supply routes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids blockaded the classroom door with chairs, causing a traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure blockaded her from taking any risks in life.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog blockaded the view, making it impossible to see beyond a few feet.

meanings.definition: To obstruct or hinder (movement or progress) by setting up a blockade
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree blockaded the road, preventing any cars from passing through.
meanings.sent2: The protestors blockaded the entrance to the building, demanding to be heard.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn lock blockaded the door, refusing to open no matter how hard she turned the key.
meanings.sent4: His anxiety blockaded his thoughts, making it difficult to focus on anything else.
meanings.sent5: The massive boulder blockaded the river, causing the water to flow around it in a new direction.
